1.text: Ripen the mango in a paper bag or newspaper.

2.text: Submerge the mango in a bowl of uncooked rice or popcorn kernels.

3.text: Set the unripe mango on the kitchen counter at room temperature.

4.text: Smell the mango for the most reliable results.

5.text: Squeeze the mango gently after you've sniffed.

6.text: Don't rely on colour to judge the ripeness of a mango.

7.text: Don't be scared away by a few black spots on the surface of the mango skin.

8.text: Place the whole mango in the refrigerator when it has ripened.

9.text: Peel and chop the ripe mango if desired
